httpserver

Class HTTPResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • httpserver.HTTPResponse

  • public class HTTPResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    An HTTPResponse is used to set output values, and to write those values to the client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EXCEPTION_ERROR
      Generic error message for when an exception occurs on the server
      static java.lang.String MALFORMED_INPUT_ERROR
      Generic error message for when the browser sends bad data
      static java.lang.String NOT_A_METHOD_ERROR
      Generic error message for when there isn't a method assigned to the requested path
      static java.lang.String STATUS_GOOD
      Generic status message for when everything is good

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPResponse

        public HTTPResponse(HTTPRequest req)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new HTTPResponse to fill out.

        It defaults to sending a text/plain type document, with a status of 200 Ok, with a body of nothing.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • message

        public void message(int code,
           java.lang.String message)
        Send a simple string message with an HTTP response code back to the client.

        Can be used for sending all data back.

        Parameters:
        code - An HTTP response code.
        message - The content of the server's response to the browser
        See Also:
        error(int, java.lang.String, java.lang.Throwable), noContent()

      • noContent

        public void noContent()
        Tell the browser there is no response data.

        This is done by sending over a 204 code, which means there isn't any data in the stream, but the server correctly processed the request

        See Also:
        message(int, java.lang.String)

      • error

        public void error(int code,
         java.lang.String message,
         java.lang.Throwable t)
        Send a message to the browser and print an exception

        Prints the stackTrace of `t`, and sends a message `message` back to the browser, with that HTTP status of `code`

        Parameters:
        code - HTTP status code
        message - the content being sent back to the browser
        t - A throwable object, to be printed to the screen
        See Also:
        message(int, java.lang.String)

      • respond

        public void respond()
        Send data back to the client.
